intro: Conanthus flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered conanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and in woodland areas. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Conanthus flavescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
